alert.note: Alert for Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 20 at 6:58AM EST until December 20 at 8:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Maine... Penobscot River At West Enfield affecting Penobscot County. For the Penobscot River...including Mattawamkeag, Grindstone, West Enfield, Eddington, Bangor...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Penobscot River at West Enfield. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, River is out of banks in several areas with high flows. Residents along the river should prepare for flooding if additional rises are expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 18.4 feet. - Low-lying flooding is ongoing - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 AM EST Wednesday was 18.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.5 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.5 feet on 12/15/2010. - For flood safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 700 PM EST.
